title: Alex Singleton had a funny contract request for Broncos
description: Alex Singleton knows the Russell Wilson contract is now off the Broncos' books, and he'd like to be re-signed.
fullText:
With former quarterback Russell Wilson's contract fallout now finally off the books, Denver Broncos linebacker Alex Signleton has a funny contract request for the team's front office.

Singleton, who is scheduled to become an unrestricted free agent in March, was asked what he'd like to receive this spring.

"To be the richest player ever, right?" Singleton said, via the Denver Post's Parker Gabriel. "We have a lot of free Russell money, right? I‚Äôll take $35 million a year."

Denver ate $53 million worth of "dead money" in 2024 and another $32 million in 2025 after cutting Wilson. His contract will no longer count against the team's cap in 2026.

Singleton, of course, was joking ‚Äî and Denver's current projected to have about $35 million of total cap space this offseason. The veteran linebacker led the team with 135 tackles this season despite missing a game in November after undergoing surgery to remove testicular cancer.

Singleton is now cancer-free, and he'd like to re-sign with the Broncos. He averaged about $6 million per year on his previous contract. Now 32 years old, Spotrac.com estimates Singleton has a market value of $4.7 million going into 2026.

Social: Follow¬†Broncos Wire¬†on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†Twitter/X!¬†Did you know:¬†These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL free agency: Alex Singleton's funny contract request for Broncos

title: Chiefs DL George Karlaftis wins 2025 Ed Block Courage Award
description: Kansas City Chiefs defensive lineman George Karlaftis wins 2025 Ed Block Courage Award | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
The Kansas City Chefs have announced their special team awards for the 2025 season. George Karlaftis wins the 2025 Ed Block Courage Award, showing grit and bravery well beyond the football field.

The Ed Block Courage Award is annually presented to one member of each team and recognizes a player who exemplifies commitment to the principles of sportsmanship and courage.

"I know one thing about this team that whoever is going to get the opportunity is going to step up and make the most out of it," said Karlaftis to reporters before Week 16, helping to inspire his teammates, "There's guys that haven't seen the field all year that are hungry. Guys that want to prove what they're made of and all that stuff. Whoever's out there, that's what coach said, whoever's out there is going to play to the best of their abilities and finish this thing out strong."

Congrats on winning the Ed Block Courage Award, @TheGK3! pic.twitter.com/7HmMn6AAQP

‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs (@Chiefs) January 24, 2026

Karlaftis finished last season with 48 total tackles and six sacks in 16 games. He also had a fumble recovery with two pass deflections.

All of the team awards were voted on by the players themselves, reflecting the locker room's true feelings about the starting defensive end.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Chiefs DL George Karlaftis wins 2025 Ed Block Courage Award

title: Birmingham sign Spanish winger Vicente
description: Championship play-off hopefuls Birmingham City make their fifth signing of the January transfer window with the arrival of Deportivo Alaves winger Carlos Vicente.
fullText:
Birmingham City have signed Spanish winger Carlos Vicente from Deportivo Alaves for an undisclosed fee.

The 26-year-old has agreed a three-and-a-half year contract at St. Andrew's and becomes the Championship club's fifth new arrival of the January transfer window.

Vicente started his career at Real Zaragoza before joining Alaves from second-tier side Racing Ferrol just over two years ago.

He has made 76 appearances in La Liga, scored 12 goals and contributed nine assists.

This season, he has played 20 times and scored five times, including against Real Madrid in Alaves' 2-1 defeat in December and in their 2-1 win over Real Betis at the weekend in what turned out to be his final appearance.

Birmingham sign Danish striker Priske

Brighton winger Osman joins Birmingham City on loan

Birmingham sign Solis on loan for rest of season

Birmingham sign left-back Wagner from MLS

Vicente described the chance to move to Blues "really interesting".

"When I heard about Birmingham, I was really interested in the project here," he said.

"The opportunity, the project, but also how much they wanted me. That's really important to me.

"It's a big challenge to come and get the promotion that the team and the city deserve.

"I'm here to complete this challenge because it is a big motivation for me."

Vicente follows striker August Priske, and defender Kai Wagner in signing for the club permanently this month in addition to the loan deals for winger Ibrahim Osman and midfielder Jhon Solis.

title: Every Colorado football player to earn NFL Pro Bowl honors
description: Shedeur Sanders joins an elite group of Colorado Buffaloes to earn NFL Pro Bowl honors. Here‚Äôs every former Buff to make a Pro Bowl roster.
fullText:
In light of Shedeur Sanders being added to the AFC Pro Bowl roster yesterday as a replacement quarterback, we decided to take a look at the other Colorado Buffaloes who have earned NFL Pro Bowl honors, either as original selections or alternates. Sanders becomes just the second quarterback in program history to make a Pro Bowl, joining Kordell Stewart, who was selected in 2001. He is also only the fourth Colorado player to be named to the Pro Bowl since 2010, alongside LT David Bakhtiari, RB Phillip Lindsay, and OL Andre Gurode.

In total, 19 Colorado Buffaloes have gone on to become NFL Pro Bowlers.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 12 games played, three interceptions for 13 return yards, 3 fumbles recovered (1959); 12 games played, one interception for 14 return yards (1960).

Brookshier was a standout three-year letterman at the University of Colorado, excelling as a defensive back, fullback, and return specialist. He finished his career with six interceptions and led the nation in punt returns in 1951, averaging 12.0 yards per return.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 14 games played, three interceptions for 41 return yards.

Dove was an exceptional running back and defensive back for the University of Colorado from 1956 to 1958. A key contributor in the single-wing offense, he rushed for more than 1,200 yards over his final two seasons and was selected in the third round of the 1959 NFL Draft.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Was one of the top guards in the NFL and helped Cleveland running backs Jim Brown and Leroy Kelly have historic seasons.

Wooten became just the fifth player in Colorado history to earn All-America honors and the first lineman to do so when he was recognized in 1958. A three-year letterman at guard from 1956 to 1958, he was named an All-American by the AFCA in his senior season, following a first-team All-Big Seven selection as a junior the year before.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 14 games played, 44 receptions, 610 receiving yards, four touchdowns (1965); 14 games played, 54 receptions, 836 receiving yards, four touchdowns (1967).

Although listed as a quarterback, Dowler was a versatile "triple-threat" in Dal Ward's single-wing offense. He caught 41 passes for 628 yards and six touchdowns, threw for 769 yards and seven scores, and averaged 43.6 yards per punt. On defense, he intercepted 10 passes, the second-most in school history at the time. A three-time All-Big Seven selection and honorable mention All-American in 1958, Dowler was later inducted into both the CU Athletic Hall of Fame and the Colorado Sports Hall of Fame.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Three interceptions for 34 return yards, led the NFL with 5 fumble recoveries and scored one defensive touchdown (1972); Anderson had his peak year in 1973, leading the NFL with 8 interceptions for 163 yards and adding two pick-six touchdowns. In 1974, his numbers dipped, but he still earned Pro Bowl recognition, finishing with one interception for 14 yards.

Anderson earned consensus All-American honors in 1967 and was known for his versatility on the field. He finished his college career with 14 interceptions and 266 tackles, setting school records at the time. In recognition of his outstanding achievements, he was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 1993.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 14 games played, 51 catches, 983 receiving yards, nine touchdowns (1975); 14 games played, 46 catches, 1,111 receiving yards, 12 touchdowns (1976); 13 games played, 33 catches, 540 receiving yards, six touchdowns (1977); 16 games played, 49 catches, 709 receiving yards, one touchdown (1978).

In 22 games at Colorado, Branch caught 36 passes for 665 yards and 11 touchdowns while rushing 31 times for 354 yards and five scores, averaging 11.4 yards per carry. Renowned for his blazing speed, he recorded 11 plays of 59 yards or longer during his time in Boulder.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Played in 16 games and had eight interceptions and three touchdowns (1978). In 1989, he played 16 games, recording five interceptions and a touchdown.

Perry earned All-Big Eight Conference honors and was named an honorable mention All-American in 1974. Known for his speed, he was a key contributor on defense for the Buffaloes before being selected in the 1975 NFL Draft.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Tackles were not officially recorded, but Johnson was a force and anchored the Eagles' defensive line during this three-year Pro Bowl stint.

In 1976, the Associated Press (AP) selected Johnson to the first-team All-Big Eight, and he was an honorable mention All-American. He received Colorado's Dave Jones award as the team's most valuable defensive lineman.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Nine games, one interception (shortened 1982 season); 15 games, three interceptions (1983); 15 games, seven interceptions, two fumble recoveries

At the time of his graduation, Haynes' 256 career tackles ranked second all-time for a defensive back at Colorado, and his 17 pass deflections were tied for seventh. Known for his speed, running a 4.4-second 40-yard dash, he made a lasting impact on the field and was later named a first-team member of CU's All-Century team in 1989.

Pro Bowl Season Stats:¬†56 total tackles, 13 sacks, three forced fumbles and a fumble recovery

Williams won the 1990 Butkus Award and led the Buffs to a national championship. A two-time Big Eight Defensive Player of the Year, he finished as CU's all-time leader in sacks (35) and tackles for loss (59), later earning College Football Hall of Fame honors.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 16 games, 48 total tackles, one sack and one fumble recovery

He was second-team All-Conference as a sophomore, first-team all-Big Eight as a junior, and a second-team All-American selection as a senior. Steed ranks tied for 22nd on CU's all-time sacks list and 19th in tackles for a loss.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 81 tackles, 13.0 sacks, three forced fumbles, two interceptions (1996); 149 tackles, 7.5 sacks, one interception, one forced fumble and one fumble recovery (1998); 116 tackles, 5.5 sacks, six passes defended, two forced fumbles (1999)

He ended his career as Colorado's fourth all-time leading tackler with 369 stops, ranked third all-time in solo tackles with 242, and fourth in tackles for loss with 38. He played inside linebacker as a freshman and sophomore before moving to the outside, where he recorded 14 quarterback sacks over the next two seasons.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 60.2 percent completion rate, 3,109 passing yards, 14 touchdowns, 11 interceptions; 96 carries, 537 yards, five touchdowns

Stewart finished his career as Colorado's leader in both total offense and passing yards with 6,481, and through 2017, he still ranked second and fourth in those categories. His 27-5-1 record as a starter, an 83.3 winning percentage, remains the best in CU history for any quarterback. He was named first-team All-Big Eight as a senior in 1994 and received the Zack Jordan Award as the Buffs' most valuable player, leading Colorado to an 11-1 record and a number three national ranking.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Started 16 games, recorded 90 tackles, one interception, 12 passes defended and two forced fumbles

At Colorado, as a senior, he was a unanimous All-Big 12 Conference first-team choice, earned third-team All-America honors, and was a semi-finalist for the¬†Jim Thorpe Award, given to the nation's top defensive back. He led the team with 112 tackles and five¬†interceptions, one of which he returned for a touchdown. He also holds the school record with 6.5 career sacks for a defensive back.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 16 games started, average of 45.3 yards per punt, 66 total punts for 2,987 yards (1999);16 games started, 44.4 yards per punt, 81 total punts for 3,595 yards.

Berger played three seasons at Colorado, where he served as the team's punter and kicker, contributing to the team before being drafted by the NFL in the sixth round.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Earned five consecutive Pro Bowl selections (2006-2010) as a center for the Dallas Cowboys. He served as a durable anchor on this offensive line, starting all 16 games in 2008, 2009 and 2010.

At Colorado, Gurode was a first-team All-Big 12 selection in 2000 and 2001, and was recognized as a consensus first-team All-American as a senior in 2001. During his career, he allowed just 7.5 sacks in 2,653 plays as a starter for the Buffaloes.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 15 games, 1,037 rushing yards, nine touchdowns; 35 receptions for 241 yards and one touchdown

Lindsay became Colorado's all-time leader in all-purpose yards with 5,760 and yards from scrimmage with 4,683, totals that rise to 5,926 and 4,849, including the 2016 Alamo Bowl. He finished as the Buffs' second all-time leading rusher with 3,707 yards and was the first player in CU history to record back-to-back 1,000-yard seasons, and only the second to do so over any two seasons. With 110 receptions for 976 yards, he also set school records for the most catches and receiving yards by a running back. Lindsay became the 14th player to join CU's 500/500 Club for rushing and receiving yards, narrowly missing the milestone of 1,000 in both categories.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: Started 16 games, allowing only 4 sacks (2016); Started 16 games, earning his second-team All-Pro honors (2019); Started 12 games, allowing only one sack and one quarterback hit, with a 91.8 Pro Football Focus pass-blocking grade before a torn ACL (2020).

A two-time second-team All-Pac 12 selection (2011, 2012) and a 2012 team captain, he was known for his durability and high-grade efficiency, allowing only two-and-a-half sacks in his final season.

Pro Bowl Season Stats: 8 games started, 1,400 passing yards, 8 total touchdowns, 10 interceptions

Sander finished his 24-start Colorado career 651-of-907 (71.8%) with 7,364 yards, 64 touchdowns, and 13 interceptions.¬†He broke over 100 school records and finished third in passing yards, fifth in attempts, third in completions, first in passing touchdowns, and tops in QB rating.

With Shedeur Sanders earning his spot as a replacement, the hope is that Colorado can continue to produce more NFL talent and, more importantly, legitimate NFL stars. Entering the 2025 NFL season, 12 former Buffaloes were on active NFL rosters. Those are numbers Deion Sanders is clearly aiming to grow in 2026 and beyond.

Contact/Follow us¬†@BuffaloesWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Colorado¬†news, notes and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Buffaloes Wire: Every Colorado football player to make an NFL Pro Bowl

title: Suns 'love our group' as trade deadline nears, Jalen Green returns
description: The 2026 NBA trade deadline is Feb. 5. Phoenix Suns head coach Jordan Ott explains where his head is at before the deadline.
fullText:
Jordan Ott‚Äôs primary focus as a first-year head coach has been on present, not the past or future.

So the way he first answered a question about the Feb. 5 trade deadline wasn‚Äôt surprising.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to win a game tonight,‚Äù a smiling Ott said during pregame availability Jan. 27, as the Phoenix Suns (27-19) face the Brooklyn Nets (12-32) at Mortgage Matchup Center.

The Suns are seventh in the Western Conference and are playing above preseason predictions, but they‚Äôve made trade deadline moves before under team owner Mat Ishbia starting with the blockbuster Kevin Durant deal in 2023.

However, Ott said the Suns ‚Äúlove‚Äù the team currently constructed as they‚Äôre eyeing the return of Jalen Green moving forward.

Suns coach Jordan Ott on Feb. 5 trade deadline: "We have people in place in leadership to take care of a lot of that stuff. We know it's right around the corner, but we love our group. We continue to say that. Our group growing internally. Our big piece we're going to get back is‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/X7MkHgKaMG

‚Äî Duane Rankin (@DuaneRankin) January 28, 2026

‚ÄúWe have people in place in leadership to take care of a lot of that stuff,‚Äù Ott said. "We know it's right around the corner, but we love our group. We love our group. We continue to say that. Our group is growing internally. Our big piece we're going to get back is Jalen Green and that's what we're excited about.‚Äù

Phoenix can‚Äôt trade any first-round picks through 2032. The Suns can move their 2033 first-round pick the night of the 2026 draft.

Green missed a second straight game after tweaking his right hamstring in the first quarter of Friday‚Äôs loss to the Atlanta Hawks to end six-game road trip.

That was Green‚Äôs second game back after missing 33 consecutive games with what the Suns called a right hamstring strain. He‚Äôs only played four games in his first season with the Suns, who acquired him from the Houston Rockets in the Kevin Durant trade.

The Suns had an MRI on Green after the Atlanta game that revealed no new damage. Green has had two workouts since with the latest one after Tuesday‚Äôs morning shootaround.

‚ÄúEverything seems to be good,‚Äù Ott said. ‚ÄúWe'll continue to reassess. Get him back on the court when he's ready to go."

Ott has said Green is day-to-day, adding Tuesday that Green doesn‚Äôt need to do 5-on-5 to return to the court. Green had multiple 5-on-5 runs with teammates, coaches and staff before returning Jan. 20 against Philadelphia during the six-game road trip after missing 33 consecutive games.

‚ÄúHe had enough before he came back the last time,‚Äù Ott said. ‚ÄúIt's more just, feel good. We're right there. It's nothing new. That was helpful. Just ease the mind. He's been out two months so some of that is expected. It's a new era for him, too. He's never had something like this. When he feels right, he'll be back out there. Dying to get back out there. We're dying to have him out there, but we want to have him right."

Green is averaging a career-low 11.8 points in his four games with the Suns.

Phoenix is also down Devin Booker (right ankle sprain), Collin Gillespie (right hand sprain) and two-way player Isaiah Livers (illness).

Ott said Gillespie hurt his hand when falling to the floor in Sunday‚Äôs loss to the Miami Heat and that it‚Äôs a ‚Äúshort-term‚Äù injury. Booker sprained his right ankle in the third quarter of the Atlanta loss. The Suns announced Sunday, Jan. 25, that Booker would be re-evaluated in a week.

Have opinions about the current state of the¬†Suns? Reach Suns Insider Duane Rankin at¬†dmrankin@gannett.com¬†or contact him at 480-810-5518. Follow him on X, formerly Twitter, at¬†@DuaneRankin.

Support local journalism: com¬†today.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Suns 'excited' about Jalen Green's return as NBA trade deadline nears

title: 3 Texas A&M matchups ranked in ESPN's top 100 games of the 2025 season
description: ESPN's Top 100 games during the 2025 season includes two memorable Texas A&M wins, while the CFP loss to Miami is ranked higher than expected.
fullText:
Texas A&M's 2025 football season was a mixed bag for most of the fan base, but it was historic nonetheless, as second-year head coach Mike Elko and his veteran squad reeled off 11 consecutive wins, including road victories over Notre Dame, LSU, and Missouri.

However, back-to-back losses to Texas in Austin and Miami in the first round of the College Football Playoff, the program's first postseason appearance was a major disappointment given the circumstances, the advantage of playing in Kyle Field, while starting quarterback Marcel Reed failed to connect on several throws that would have given the Aggies the lead.

Still, the wind, which was even worse on the field, affected both teams, but thanks to a healthy running game, combined with Texas A&M's inability to stop the run late in the game, Miami running back Mark Fletcher racked up over 150 yards, leading to the Hurricanes finding the endzone, and ultimately winning the game 10-3. Yes, Miami made it all the way to the National Championship, but the Aggies had every chance to pull out the victory.

Coupled with the insane comeback win over South Carolina, ESPN's Bill Connelly placed three of Texas A&M's memorable matchups on his top 100 games of the 2025 season, starting with the first-round playoff loss to Miami, which he surprisingly placed at No. 16, even though this was a slog fest before Miami's final drive in the fourth quarter.

"Maybe the most aesthetically ...¬†unique¬†game of the season. Before Miami could make a run to the CFP championship game, the Hurricanes had to survive impossibly windy conditions (and a strong Texas A&M defense) in College Station. Carson Beck threw for only 103 yards, and the teams combined to miss four of six field goal attempts.¬†Malachi Toney¬†lost a key fourth-quarter fumble, but a 56-yard¬†Mark Fletcher Jr. run set up Toney's redemption moment -- an 11-yard jet sweep TD with 1:44 left. Texas A&M rallied, driving 70 yards in just 1:20, but¬†Bryce Fitzgerald¬†picked off a third-and-goal pass in the end zone, and Miami advanced."

Coming in at No. 11, Texas A&M's 31-30 win over South Carolina did not end up being the catalyst many of us thought it would be, but it will be remembered as one of the greatest comebacks of all time, regardless of how the season finished out. Trailing 30-3 at the half, the Aggies went from playing their worst football of the year to looking like an unstoppable force on both sides of the ball.

"It was the biggest comeback in Texas A&M history, without which the Aggies probably wouldn't have made the playoff. It was also a day that featured both the worst and best halves of¬†Marcel Reed's career. In the first half, he completed only 6 of 19 passes with two terrible interceptions and two sacks, one of which produced a fumble returned for a score by¬†Nick Barrett. LaNorris Sellers threw a 50-yard touchdown to¬†Vandrevius Jacobs¬†and an 80-yarder to¬†Nyck Harbor¬†(complete with a really strange¬†interaction with a state trooper), and the Gamecocks cruised into halftime up 30-3.

In the second half, A&M woke up, and the Gamecocks clammed up. Reed went 16-for-20 for 298 yards and three third-quarter touchdowns -- 27 yards to¬†Izaiah Williams, 39 to¬†Ashton Bethel-Roman, 14 to¬†Nate Boerkircher¬†-- and the Aggies gained 371 yards while allowing 76. They needed only 20 minutes to take a 31-30 lead, and South Carolina could never mount a rally. It was the most strangely straightforward 27-point comeback you'll ever see."

Lastly, at No. 4, Texas A&M's most important win of the season was going on the road in Week 3 against a 0-1 Notre Dame team that had lost a close road battle against Miami the week prior.

Having not won a ranked non-conference road game in over 40 years, a botched snap on an extra point, paired with Marcel Reed driving the Aggies down the field, finding tight end Nate Boerkircher for the game-tying touchdown, was by far the most exciting moment of the 2025 season outside of Indiana winning its first national title.

"A botched PAT snap and hold might have made the difference in a playoff bid. Texas A&M led 28-24 after a wild first half, and after a reasonably tame third quarter, the action picked up again late. With the score tied at 34-34,¬†Jeremiyah Love¬†capped a 12-play, six-minute drive with a 12-yard touchdown, but a botched hold on the PAT left the Irish's lead at just six points. A third-down scramble from Marcel Reed and a defensive holding penalty gave A&M a first-and-goal, but that quickly became fourth-and-goal from the 11. No worries -- with 19 seconds left, Reed found¬†Nate Boerkircher¬†for the game-winner. (Well, I guess¬†Randy Bond's PAT was the actual game winner, but still.)"

Texas A&M will open the 2026 season against Missouri State on Saturday, September 5.

Contact/Follow us @AggiesWire on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions. Follow Cameron on X: @CameronOhnysty.

This article originally appeared on Aggies Wire: Three Texas A&M matchups ranked in ESPN's top 100 2025 CFB games

title: Notre Dame loses assistant who follows brother to rival Big Ten team
description: Notre Dame football has lost another coach to Michigan State, as assistant wide receivers coach Dom Spalding will join his brother in East Lansing.
fullText:
Notre Dame football has suffered a few coaching losses this offseason, the biggest happening this weekend with Mike Mickens going to the NFL.

Some of the moves have been on the smaller side, as was with assistant wide receivers coach Dom Spalding, who will join his brother at Michigan State according to On3‚Äôs Mike Singer. His stay in South Bend was a short one, after joining the program just under a year ago.

There another reunion of for Spalding in East Lansing, as he‚Äôll rejoin former Irish linebackers coach Max Bullough, who left earlier this offseason to become the Spartans co-defensive coordinator. This is somewhat of a loss, as it‚Äôs never good to lose an rising young coach, but like with Mickens leaving, you have to trust that head coach Marcus Freeman will find a more than suitable replacement.

Notre Dame assistant WRs coach Dom Spalding has followed his brother, Devon, to join the Michigan State Spartans staff. He'll hold the same position in East Lansing.https://t.co/eLWAke5n9G pic.twitter.com/N7fb2I8FEZ

‚Äî BlueandGold.com (@BGInews) January 27, 2026

Contact/Follow us¬†@IrishWireND¬†on X (Formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Notre Dame news, notes, and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Fighting Irish Wire: Notre Dame loses assistant who follows brother to rival Big Ten team

title: Should New York Giants reunite Odell Beckham Jr. with John Harbaugh?
description: A WFAN host argues that the New York Giants should sign WR Odell Beckham Jr., reuniting him with head coach John Harbaugh.
fullText:
Following the New York Giants' hiring of John Harbaugh, the top head coaching candidate on the market, excitement surrounds the changes the Giants will make this offseason.

Harbaugh has already begun overhauling the coaching staff, bringing in several coaches he previously worked with during his time with the Baltimore Ravens. With free agency approaching, many have speculated about Ravens free agents who could follow their former head coach to New York.

There may also be interest in targeting free agents who previously played for both the Giants and Harbaugh, such as Kevin Zeitler, Jihad Ward, or even former star receiver Odell Beckham Jr.

WFAN's Tommy Lugauer believes a reunion with Beckham is something the Giants should explore.

Tommy calls for the Giants to bring back Odell Beckham Jr:@tommylugauer pic.twitter.com/i9TRz55iBu

‚Äî WFAN Sports Radio (@WFAN660) January 27, 2026

"So here's my suggestion. A wide receiver that is no stranger to the Giants, a wide receiver that is no stranger to John Harbaugh. A wide receiver that has already had a conversation with Jaxson Dart about John Harbaugh," he said. "And that man's name is Odell Beckham Jr. That's right. OBJ reuniting in New York in a different role than he had in his previous stop, where he was the number one wide receiver, the playmaker. Now as a grizzled vet, a guy that's won a championship, has been around the block -- a chance to come back home.

"A chance to reunite not only with the Giants but with John Harbaugh, and be a valued wide receiver and playmaker for young Jaxson Dart and a young Giants offense. So there's already a relationship with Harbaugh and OBJ. There's obviously a relationship with Beckham and the Giants. Many were sad when he was sent away, when he was traded off. Now here's the opportunity for the reunion. So Joe Schoen, John Harbaugh -- make it happen. Odell Beckham Jr. back with the Giants."

A Beckham-Giants reunion has been discussed for years following the trade that sent the former first-round pick to the Cleveland Browns. Beckham was one of the franchise's most popular players in recent memory, and he has certainly shown interest in returning to the Giants before his career ends.

As much fun as the reunion may be, it is certainly questionable how much production Beckham could add as a playmaker at 33 years old.

He last played in 2024 with the Miami Dolphins, appearing in nine games and hauling in just nine catches for 55 yards. Beckham also played for Harbaugh and the Ravens in 2023, when he racked up over 500 yards and three touchdowns on 35 receptions.

With the Giants relying heavily on the return of Malik Nabers and many questions surrounding the wide receiver corps beyond him, Beckham could provide veteran leadership for his fellow LSU alumnus to learn from and someone the young receivers can lean on during Nabers' recovery from injury.

Beckham, of course, also suffered a pair of ACL tears in his post-Giants career, including one in Super Bowl LVI, where he scored the game's first touchdown, helping the Rams secure the Lombardi Trophy.

Beckham has previously expressed interest in continuing his career, and finishing it in a Giants uniform could be just what he needs. However, it would have to make sense for the Giants, who would need to feel confident in Beckham's ability to help the team at this stage of his career.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Should New York Giants reunite Odell Beckham Jr. with John Harbaugh?

title: Patriots cheer captain flaunts chiseled, taut core in string bikini
description: As the Patriots gear up for the Super Bowl, one of the team‚Äôs cheerleaders is celebrating her birthday ‚Äî and the team‚Äôs captain kicked off the celebration with a bikini post of the two friends flaunting their chiseled dancer‚Äôs bodies in teeny bikinis.
fullText:
Patriots cheer captain flaunts chiseled, taut core in string bikini originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Patriots cheerleader Emily Marshall is celebrating her birthday as the team gears up for Super Bowl 60. So her friend ‚Äî the squad‚Äôs captain, Taylor Yeley ‚Äî kicked off the birthday wishes with a 10-image nod to their special times together.

The cover photo is a snapshot of the dancers flaunting their hard-earned, chiseled dancer‚Äôs figures in teeny bikinis.

‚ÄúHappy birthday to @emily_m127 !!!üíóüéâ ‚Äú Yeley captioned her Tuesday, January 27 share to Instagram. ‚Äú10 pics aren‚Äôt enough to capture all the laughs, long car rides, girls night outs, & nepc memories from day 1 have made us like sisters. I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for our friendship & can‚Äôt wait to celebrate you x 1000 tn at practice and allllll week at the SUPERBOWL‚ù§Ô∏èüíôüèÜ ily most.‚Äù

Marshall responded, ‚ÄúTOO MANY AMAZING MEMS‚Äù and ‚ÄúLOVE YOU SOOOO MUCH!!üíóüíóüíóüíó.‚Äù

‚ÄúLove you both so much!!!,‚Äù wrote one commenter. ‚ÄúHappy birthday.‚Äù

‚ÄúAn iconic duo,‚Äù raved another. ‚ÄúLove you both & HAPPY BIRTHDAY EM‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è.‚Äù

Both women are four-year veterans of the cheerleading team; Yeley also works as a marketing coordinator at a financial advisory firm, while Marshall serves as a financial analyst for an environmental consulting firm, according to the team‚Äôs official roster.

title: Is Odegaard‚Äôs Arsenal captaincy at risk?
description: Mikel Arteta has denied that Martin Odegaard‚Äôs role as Arsenal‚Äôs captain is at risk, despite the midfielder playing a little bit less in recent weeks.Photo by Shaun Botterill/Getty ImagesArsenalÔøΩÔøΩ...
fullText:
Arsenal‚Äôs last three games have been a little unusual, in that Martin Odegaard has been fit to play in all three, but he hasn‚Äôt completed more than an hour in any of them.

The Gunners captain came off before the hour mark against Nottingham Forest, before sitting on the bench for the entirety of Arsenal‚Äôs trip to Inter Milan. He returned to the starting lineup against Manchester United, but again came off before 60 minutes.

Even in the two games prior to this run, Odegaard only completed 68 minutes against Chelsea and 21 against Portsmouth. You have to go back to 2025 to find the Norway international‚Äôs last full 90.

The run raises some questions about the 27-year-old, and whether Mikel Arteta still considers him a key player in vital moments. But when asked whether Odegaard‚Äôs role as captain could be at risk on Tuesday, Arteta was emphatic.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Arteta responded. ‚ÄúThe minutes [he plays] as well are related because obviously he had two shoulder injuries¬†and he was out for six weeks with a knee injury as well.

‚ÄúWe have the possibility to change games and the games maybe require something different¬†and every player is very important to be able to achieve that.‚Äù

It‚Äôs true that Odegaard has struggled with injuries this season, picking up three different injuries in his first three Premier League appearances at the Emirates Stadium in 2025/26.

In all, the former Real Madrid man has missed 11 matches, as well as most of the three in which he had to come off injured.

That‚Äôs quite a significant portion of the campaign, especially for someone who missed less than 10 games injured in his first three and a half seasons with the club.

But Arsenal need their captain to find some consistency now, as the club approach the business end of the season.

title: ACC Roundup ‚Äì State Rising, Virginia Surviving, Deacs And Jackets Fading
description: Virginia nearly blew a game against 11-10 Notre Dame but State is making progress
fullText:
Tuesday‚Äôs ACC Action went about as we expected, but it was a close-run thing. NC State and Virginia Tech won, as expected, but Wake Forest was knocked off by Pitt and Notre Dame took Virginia to double-overtime before falling just short.

NC State added to Syracuse‚Äôs misery, winning 88-68. The Pack shot 51% to 39% for the Orange. State dominated the boards too, 45-33. Donnie Freeman was the brightest spot for the ‚ÄòCuse with 24 points and 10 rebounds. JJ Starling had 17 points.

Darrion Williams had 23 points, 6 rebounds and 5 assists for State. Ven-Allen Lubin racked up 18 and 9 while former Syracuse player Quadir Copeland had 19 points, 9 assists and 4 steals against his old team.

Adrian Autry was already getting some heat coming into this one and a 20-point loss where his team didn‚Äôt really defend won‚Äôt help.

You have to feel for the Irish. Notre Dame was up 19 on a really good Virginia team but gave it all up and the game went to double OT where the ‚ÄòHoos won, 100-97.

All of Notre Dame‚Äôs big men fouled out, basically trying to guard Thijs De Ridder, who hit 14-15 from the line. He finished with 32 points and 8 rebounds.

Sam Lewis had 21 points, 9 rebounds and 6 assists and impressive freshman Chance Mallory ended up with 17 points.

The way this game is being framed is that Notre Dame blew it but that‚Äôs not really fair. The Irish played way over their head and simply couldn‚Äôt sustain it, as the foul situation indicates. It was a game effort and deserves respect, not mockery. Better question: what‚Äôs going on with Virginia? They couldn‚Äôt keep up with UNC and it took two OTs to beat a team that is missing their best player and that couldn‚Äôt defend against them inside. What‚Äôs up with the ‚ÄòHoos?

Like Virginia, Pitt fell behind early and came back to in in overtime, 80-76. As noted previously, Wake‚Äôs inside woes are tough to overcome. Cooper Schwieger had 7 points but did grab 11 boards, Tre‚ÄôVon Spillers had 8 points and 3 boards and Omaha Biliew had 1 point and 1 board.

The perimeter carried the day, again. Juke Harris had 17 points and 5 boards, Myles Colvin had 18 and Nate Calmese finished with 10.

You can win with minimal front court production, but your backcourt has to be really good, a la Georgia Tech‚Äôs Lethal Weapon 3 offense of Kenny Anderson, Dennis Scott and Brian Oliver. Wake‚Äôs is good but not that good, plus Tech had Matt Geiger and Malcolm Mackey, solid if unspectacular bigs.

Roman Siulepa continues to improve and finished with 15 points and 15 rebounds but Omari Witherspoon was the hero of the day. In overtime, he got a key steal, deflected a three and then hit a clutch three of his own with 15 seconds left. Great effort by the freshman.

Both teams had lost three straight. Pitt is 9-12 and Wake is barely over .500 at 11-10.

Virginia Tech cleaned up on threes and at the line in a 71-65 win over the Yellow Jackets. The Hokies outscored Georgia Tech 24-6 on threes and won free throws 19-12.

Tobi Lawal is back in the starting lineup for Virginia Tech and their lineup now is pretty impressive: Lawal, Amani Hansberry who has really excelled, Neoklis Avdalas, who has certainly had his moments, Jailen Bedford and Ben Hammonds, who finished with 20 here.

Georgia Tech made a nice comeback but it wasn‚Äôt quite enough to pull off the upset.

With the win, Virginia Tech is 16-6 and an NCAA bid is certainly on the table if they continue to play well.

On Wednesday, the Florida schools make the West Coast swing. Cal hosts Florida State while Stanford welcomes Miami.

Florida State at Cal || 7:00 || ACCN

Miami at Stanford || 9:00 || ACCN

title: Door OPENS for Liverpool to finally replace Trent Alexander-Arnold
description: The door has opened for Liverpool to finally replace Trent Alexander-Arnold. Let's be honest, the Reds are missing their former no.66. Obviously, the club's massive plight this season is not solely do...
fullText:
The door has opened for Liverpool to finally replace Trent Alexander-Arnold.

Let's be honest, the Reds are missing their former no.66. Obviously, the club's massive plight this season is not solely down to Alexander-Arnold's departure.

However, some of the struggles in build-up and creativity have been directly impacted by his lack of presence in the team and therefore the lack of players with the technical nous and ability to do what Alexander-Arnold did best.

At the same time, it's also important to note that we have discovered throughout the season that Arne Slot does not necessarily deem Jeremie Frimpong as a right-back.

In fact he's often played him as a right-winger instead. Sometimes Dominik Szoboszlai has started ahead of Frimpong at right-back.

So, the reality is that Liverpool have not even replaced Alexander-Arnold with a right-back. Meanwhile, Conor Bradley suffered an injury that means he's out for the rest of the season.

It means that looking ahead to next season, Liverpool are likely going to have to bring in more reinforcements and address the right-back question.

How they plan on doing that hinges on many things.

But the likeliest way is by entering the market and signing an actual right-back this summer. And the player they seem to be targeting according to Florian Plettenberg as per TEAMtalk is Givairo Read.

The report claims that Bayern Munich and Liverpool are both very interested in the Feyenoord right-back, but the former is currently focusing on several costly contract extensions which means the door is open for Richard Hughes to pounce and secure a deal for the talented right-back before anyone else.

What makes Read such an intriguing profile is that he is only 19-years-old but already has a lot of experience under his belt.

title: Brooks Koepka reveals what he‚Äôll miss most about LIV Golf
description: Brooks Koepka is the story in the world of golf right now, with the American set to make his return to the PGA Tour on Thursday. It was only two weeks ago when Koepka was reinstated as a PGA Tour member, after he moved on from LIV Golf on December 23rd.
fullText:
Brooks Koepka is the story in the world of golf right now, with the American set to make his return to the PGA Tour on Thursday.

It was only two weeks ago when Koepka was reinstated as a PGA Tour member, after he moved on from LIV Golf on December 23rd.

The five-time major champion is the first player to jump ship from LIV and return immediately to the PGA Tour.

Koepka managed to win a major during his time with LIV but in general, his form at the four biggest events in the game was nowhere near good enough.

The highlight of that stretch came at Augusta National, where he finished second in the Masters. Still, it‚Äôs a long way back from that peak.

PGA Tour boss Jay Monahan welcomed him back ahead of this week‚Äôs start at Torrey Pines. ‚ÄúWe are excited for Brooks‚Äô return,‚Äù Monahan said. ‚ÄúI know he wants to be here.‚Äù

Koepka has never been one to shy away from giving an honest answer. So when the 35-year-old was asked if there‚Äôs anything he misses about LIV Golf, his response felt genuine.

‚ÄúI think maybe just being around the guys, right, because we‚Äôre not ‚Äî everybody‚Äôs not around each other all the time,‚Äù Koepka said.

‚ÄúI think sometimes, I mean we were all one big traveling circus, right? That‚Äôs kind of what it is. It‚Äôs fun and I‚Äôm going to miss some of those guys, seeing those guys pretty much week to week out there. The relationships I‚Äôve built with those guys and not seeing them all the time, that will be quite different.‚Äù

Now back on the PGA Tour, Koepka will have a chance to reconnect with familiar faces and get to know some of the newer names making their mark in the sport.

During his media availability on Tuesday, Koepka was asked what he missed most about the PGA Tour while playing for LIV Golf.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a good question. I think the ability to have my family out all the time. I think that was one thing because they didn‚Äôt travel too much over the last few years.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut like they‚Äôre going to be out this week, so I am super excited to be able to have them out.‚Äú

The transition back to regular life on the PGA Tour should help with that. It also puts him back in front of some of golf‚Äôs toughest competition, something he also seemed to miss during his time with LIV.

The question now is whether Koepka can still measure up against golf‚Äôs elite after his time away. The Farmers Insurance Open this week will give us an early look at how well he adapts back into the fold and whether he can hit the ground running.

title: LeBron James, Patrick Mahomes and more react to Bill Belichick's 'insane' Hall of Fame snub
description: They were shocked like the rest of us.
fullText:
LeBron James, Patrick Mahomes and more react to Bill Belichick's 'insane' Hall of Fame snub originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

On Tuesday, it was reported that former Patriots' head coach, an eight-time Super Bowl champion, wasn't voted as a first-ballot Hall of Famer.

Many people, from fans to players across the league, were very confused about how this happened to arguably one of the greatest coaches of all time in the NFL or any sport.

Belichick should inevitably be elected into the Hall of Fame, even though he wasn't a first-ballot HOFer, but some big names across the sports world had a lot to say about the news regarding Belichick when it came out on Tuesday.

"Man there's no way I read that right! Right? Ain't no WAY Bill Belichick ain't 1st Ballot HOF!! That's IMPOSSIBLE, EGREGIOUS, and quite frankly DISRESPECTFUL!"

MORE:¬†Unbelievable Sam Darnold stat suggests Seahawks have no chance against Drake Maye's Patriots in Super Bowl

"Insane‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt even understand how this could be possible"

"I can‚Äôt be reading this right.

This has to be some knock-off Hall of Fame or something, it can‚Äôt be the actual NFL Hall of Fame.

There is not a single world whatsoever in which Bill Belichick should not be a First-Ballot Hall of Famer."

MORE:¬†Where was Drake Maye during Patriots/Seahawks Super Bowl 49? Where the current stars of SB 60 were in 2015

"Regardless of your opinion of Bill Belichick, him not being a first ballot Hall of Famer is a disgrace ‚Äî and a direct indictment on the Hall of Fame itself.

"If Bill Belichick isn‚Äôt a 1st Ballot NFL Hall of Famer, then NO ONE SHOULD BE."

"Bill Belichick not being a first ballot Hall of Famer means that no coach should ever be. It means that the voters have decided there isn‚Äôt a coaching resume that warrants First Ballot consideration! He is the GREATEST, most ACCOMPLISHED coach of all time! This is egregious!"

MORE:¬†Drake Maye can already pass Tom Brady in this Patriots playoff stat

"Belichick was the best NFL coach ever yesterday and that‚Äôs still true today and tomorrow. The truth is ‚Äî sports Hall of Fames don‚Äôt matter nearly as much anymore because we‚Äôve screwed all of them up."

"As a HOF coach I think Bill Belichick is the greatest of all time‚Ä¶yes he had a great QB but we all did..he won AFTER THE salary cap and free agency plus I Know how much he LOVES THE NFL and the game..I‚Äôm pissed.."

title: Prop Hobson commits future to Harlequins
description: Harlequins prop Will Hobson commits his future to the club by signing his first professional contract.
fullText:
Harlequins prop Will Hobson has committed his future to the club by signing his first professional contract at the Twickenham Stoop.

The 23-year-old made his senior debut in November 2021 against Northampton Saints and has gone on to make 28 appearances for Quins.

Hobson has had a breakthrough campaign with Quins this season, featuring in nine out of their past 11 matches.

"I joined the club when I was 14 and it's been a bit of a slow burn, but this year I've had some opportunities and earned the faith of the coaches to keep that going," he told Harlequins' website.

"It's nice to be rewarded for the hard work, and a lot of that is the unseen work you put in during the week."

Coach Jason Gilmore added: "Will adds a strong, dynamic ball-carrying presence to our pack, and we're excited to see him continue to grow in a Harlequins shirt."

title: Ferguson suffers new ankle injury
description: Roma are in a major attacking crisis for tomorrow night‚Äôs match in Athens against Benitez‚Äôs Panathinaikos. The Giallorossi, who will still be without Malen and Robinio Vaz in European action, are ...
fullText:
Roma are in a major attacking crisis for tomorrow night‚Äôs match in Athens against Benitez‚Äôs Panathinaikos.

The Giallorossi, who will still be without Malen and Robinio Vaz in European action, are also without Ferguson, as well as the already injured Dovbyk.

The Irish striker was left out of tomorrow‚Äôs match due to a recurrence of pain in his left ankle, which had already sidelined him for several weeks.

Given the former Brighton player‚Äôs absence, Gasperini will once again be forced to play as a false nine, with Dybala likely to be deployed in that position.

The only attacking players called up are Pellegrini, Soul√©, Dybala, and the Primavera youth player Della Rocca. Cristante could also be moved up to the attacking midfield.

title: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of energy in this stadium‚Äù: Inter want to get back on track against BVB
description: Despite recent setbacks in the Champions League, Cristian Chivu has no doubts about the work he's doing. The former Inter professional, who took over from Simone Inzaghi in the summer, believes his te...
fullText:
Despite recent setbacks in the Champions League, Cristian Chivu has no doubts about the work he's doing. The former Inter professional, who took over from Simone Inzaghi in the summer, believes his team are on the right track in both Serie A and Europe. ‚ÄúMy team have grown mentally over the past two months ‚Äì they are playing with more conviction and ambition,‚Äù said the Romanian. ‚ÄúUps and downs are part of any development.‚Äù Despite his great respect for the difficult task ahead, his anticipation prevails: ‚ÄúWe know it‚Äôs not easy to play here. There‚Äôs a lot of energy in this stadium. Dortmund rarely lose at home. But even they have their problems sometimes.‚Äù

Defender Yann Bisseck expressed similar optimism. The Cologne-born Germany international continues to believe in a conciliatory end to the first half of the season ‚Äì including a possible jump back into the top eight teams. ‚ÄúBVB are very strong and reached the Champions League final in 2024. In this atmosphere, it‚Äôs crucial to keep a cool head,‚Äù said Bisseck. He is not intimidated by the Yellow Wall: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not afraid. We also play at San Siro, which is a special stadium.‚Äù

Like Borussia, who dropped from sixth to 16th place after a 2-2 draw with Bod√∏/Glimt and a 2-0 defeat at Tottenham Hotspur and go into the last matchday of the league phase with 11 points, Inter Milan were also unable to defend a good starting position (see facts). Victories over Ajax (2-0), Slavia Prague (3-0), Union Saint-Gilloise (4-0) and Kairat Almaty (2-1) had put the Nerazzurri in third place early on and fuelled hopes of early direct qualification for the round of 16, which is only guaranteed for the top eight teams.

This prospect is now only realistic with the help of other clubs. For the first time in the club's history, Inter failed to pick up any points in three consecutive Champions League matches ‚Äì against Atl√©tico Madrid (2-1), Liverpool (1-0) and Arsenal (3-1). As a result, they have fallen to 14th place. The away game in Dortmund is their fourth attempt to get points on the board against a major European rival.

At least the 20-time Italian champions, who will be without the injured EURO 2020 winner Nicolo Barella, are not in danger of being eliminated prematurely. With 12 points, they are guaranteed a place in the play-offs even if they lose. The teams ranked 9th to 24th will play home and away matches for the remaining places in the round of 16. With only one point separating them from sixth to eighth place, Inter could avoid this additional round by winning in Dortmund.

Chivu's team are performing very differently in Serie A. Ten games without defeat have put Inter at the top of the table, five points ahead of city rivals AC Milan. Even a 0-2 deficit had no consequences in the recent 6-2 win against bottom-of-the-table Pisa. Nevertheless, there is a parallel to their European record at national level: they have only managed one win against their direct rivals AC Milan, Roma, Napoli and Juventus.

Inter are taking heart from their positive history against BVB. The two clubs met in the semi-finals of the 1963/64 European Cup, the quarter-finals of the 1993/94 UEFA Cup and the group stage of the 2019/20 Champions League. With three wins, one draw and two defeats, Inter have a slight edge in the head-to-head record.

The club, founded in 1908, also has the edge in terms of European titles. After successes in the European Cup in 1964 and 1965, Inter won the Champions League for the third time in 2010 with a 2-0 victory over Bayern Munich. They also have three UEFA Cup triumphs to their name (1991, 1994, 1998). Further title chances have recently gone unused: in 2023, Inter lost to Manchester City (1-0) in the Champions League final and in 2025 to Paris Saint-Germain (5-0).

BVB coach Niko Kovac paid great respect to the current Italian league leaders, whose squad includes two former Dortmund players, Manuel Akanji and Henrikh Mkhitaryan: ‚ÄúWe are playing against a really strong team that has been in the final twice in the last three years. It‚Äôs anything but easy. Balance will be crucial ‚Äì we mustn‚Äôt be naive‚Äù (see preview).

title: Arne Slot to ring the changes as injury-hit Liverpool take on Qarabag
description: Liverpool are just one win away from booking a place in the Champions League last 16 as they welcome Qarabag FK to Anfield for Wednesday‚Äôs league-phase finale.Despite going through a frustrating Pre...
fullText:
Liverpool are just one win away from booking a place in the Champions League last 16 as they welcome Qarabag FK to Anfield for Wednesday‚Äôs league-phase finale.

Despite going through a frustrating Premier League campaign, Europe has continued to offer a sense of comfort for Arne Slot‚Äôs side, who remain firmly in control of their own fate.

The Reds arrive on the back of a convincing 3-0 win away to Ligue 1 giants Olympique Marseille.

Liverpool were expected to be tested by Roberto De Zerbi‚Äôs attack-minded team, but instead delivered a classic Champions League performance to see off the French powerhouse.

Goals from Dominik Szoboszlai and Cody Gakpo on either side of an unfortunate Geronimo Rulli own goal helped the Reds see out a comfortable victory.

The win against Marseille was Liverpool‚Äôs fourth success from their last five Champions League games.

They‚Äôll now head into the group phase finale in fourth place, two points clear of ninth-placed Barcelona and 13th-placed Atalanta.

A win against Qarabag will allow them to skip the play-off round and move straight into the last 16.

Liverpool are heading into this contest as overwhelming favourites, given the massive difference in quality between the two teams.

To further bolster their chances, Anfield has been a fortress in the Champions League.

Before their heavy 4-1 defeat to PSV Eindhoven, Liverpool had won 16 consecutive Champions League home games in the league or group phase.

The pummelling at the hands of PSV also represents one of just three defeats from their last 20 Champions League games at this stage.

Having failed to capitalise on that huge Marseille win on their return to domestic duties, Slot will hope a much-changed XI can get his side back to winning ways against one of the competition‚Äôs underdogs.

Alisson will likely retain his place in goal, but there could be changes across other areas of the pitch.

Wataru Endo and Andrew Robertson, who has been linked with a move to Tottenham Hotspur, should join the backline alongside Virgil van Dijk and Jeremie Frimpong.

Curtis Jones and Ryan Gravenberch may be tasked with anchoring the midfield, although Slot may decide to rest the latter and replace him with academy talent Trey Nyoni.

Rio Ngumoha could also be handed a rare start in attack alongside Alexis Mac Allister and Cody Gakpo, while Hugo Ekitike leads the line.

title: Do you care about the Pro Football Hall of Fame?
description: The Pro Football Hall of Fame took a huge hit of credibility by excluding Bill Belichick. Should we even care about it anymore?
fullText:
In about a week, the Pro Football Hall of Fame class of 2026 will be revealed. However, the biggest news to come out of that class already was revealed on Tuesday afternoon. Per a report from ESPN, legendary NFL coach Bill Belichick will somehow not be part of the class in his first year of eligibility. The reason appears to be that some Hall of Fame voters believed Belichick deserved punishment for the several cheating allegations during his tenure with the Patriots, notably spygate and deflategate.

Obviously, this news has drawn a massive amount of criticism toward the Hall of Fame, with some alleging that they will never recover from such a massive blunder. It‚Äôs a rare moment in which nearly all of the internet seems to agree that this was a ridiculous mistake, which only makes this news even more confounding. How could at least 10 of 50 voters believe Belichick wasn‚Äôt worth of first-ballot Hall of Fame status when nearly the entire internet agrees?

That leads to today‚Äôs Question of the Day:

My answer: A little, but not much.

Personally, I don‚Äôt love the idea of comparing greatness. Greatness is greatness, and the gatekeeping of who deserves the extra special designation of Hall of Famer or first-ballot Hall of Famer is missing the point of this game. Everyone who plays it hold a special place in this game‚Äôs history, and because it‚Äôs more so a team sport than just about any other one means that even some of the lesser-known players can do amazing things. Think of guys like David Tyree, who will never be a Hall of Famer, but will always be synonymous with one of the most important plays in Super Bowl history.

I also think the Hall of Fame leads to unnecessary and sometimes disrespectful debates about the GOAT. We debate resum√©s of people who played in completely different eras, and try to downplay the accomplishments of others in order to raise up our guy. I think a lot about this Kobe Bryant tweet about the NBA GOAT whenever these conversations are brought up:

We can enjoy one without tearing down one. I love what he‚Äôs doing. Don‚Äôt debate what can‚Äôt be definitively won by anyone #enjoymy5 #enjoymj6 #enjoylbjquest

‚Äî Kobe Bryant (@kobebryant) May 28, 2018

The Belichick development is just further proof that this gatekeeping of greatness is flawed, petty, and, ultimately, a waste of time.

That said, I do like the idea of honoring and preserving this game‚Äôs history. Having a literal, physical place where you can go and learn about this league‚Äôs greatest moments and best players is important to me. And I will admit those videos of players getting notified they‚Äôre entering the Hall of Fame get me everytime.

Still, the bickering over greatness is just off-putting to me, and I wish there were ways we could celebrate these players without making it feel so exclusive.

What are your thoughts about the Hall of Fame and the Belichick incident? Share your thoughts in the comment section below.

title: Sean Payton reacts as Denver Broncos make major coaching decision after AFC Championship loss
description: The Denver Broncos have acted quickly following their defeat to the New England Patriots in the AFC Championship game. They have now made a major coaching decision that underlines how high expectations remain inside the organisation.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos have acted quickly following their defeat to the New England Patriots in the AFC Championship game.

They have now made a major coaching decision that underlines how high expectations remain inside the organisation.

Despite coming within one win of the Super Bowl, head coach Sean Payton made it clear that difficult calls were unavoidable.

Payton addressed the changes publicly, offering a measured response that balanced appreciation with the reality of the NFL.

Joe Lombardi has been dismissed from his role as offensive coordinator just days after the Broncos‚Äô AFC Championship loss.

The decision brings an end to a long working relationship between Payton and Lombardi.

‚ÄúI want to thank these coaches for playing an important role in elevating our program over the last three seasons,‚Äù Payton said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been fortunate to work with Joe Lombardi for 15 years and am particularly grateful for his many contributions to our success as offensive coordinator.‚Äù

The comments underscore Payton‚Äôs respect for Lombardi, even as the Broncos choose to move in a different direction.

They also reflect how fine the margins are at the top level, where progress alone does not guarantee continuity.

Lombardi was not the only departure announced, with wide receivers coach Keary Colbert and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch also leaving the team.

With Lombardi gone, attention has already turned to who might step into a more prominent role within the offense.

Passing game coordinator Davis Webb is expected to be a potential internal candidate for promotion as the Broncos assess their next move.

Webb has received head coaching interest from around the league, which has only strengthened his standing within the organization.

That growing reputation could make continuity appealing as Payton looks to build on a season that still ended one step short.

Whether Denver opts for an internal promotion or looks outside the building, the message from Payton is clear.

After falling short in the AFC Championship game, change is seen as necessary to push the Broncos to the next level.

title: Why Bill Belichick isn't a first-ballot Hall of Famer after controversial vote: 'Six Super Bowls isn't enough?'
description: Here's why Belichick didn't make the Hall of Fame yet.
fullText:
Why Bill Belichick isn't a first-ballot Hall of Famer after controversial vote: 'Six Super Bowls isn't enough?' originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Bill Belichick is one of the winningest coaches in NFL history and the only head coach with six Super Bowl wins, but that isn't enough to make the Hall of Fame yet.

In his first year of eligibility, the former New England Patriots coach was not elected to Canton, as he did not reach the 40 votes necessary to earn an election. Belichick will remain on the ballot moving forward, but he will not be part of a prestigious group to earn a first-ballot election.

Belichick's NFL coaching career ended on a sour note, but he still has 302 regular season wins, third most all-time, and 31 playoff wins, which is the most all-time. Belichick's six Super Bowls are two more than second place, and his nine Super Bowl appearances are three more than second place.

Here's why Belichick didn't make the Hall of Fame yet.

MORE:¬†Ranking the best Patriots of all time

According to ESPN, Belichick didn't get enough votes necessary to make the Hall of Fame due to his baggage in the NFL. ESPN reports that Belichick's roles in both Spygate and Deflategate kept him out on first try, as some voters may think Belichick should wait at least a year as some sort of punishment.

"The only explanation [for the outcome] was the cheating stuff," a veteran Hall voter said, via ESPN. "It really bothered some of the guys."

Additionally, the voting process for coaches is different than the process for players. Belichick is one of five owners, executives, coaches and players competing for up to three available spots separate from teh 15 modern-era finalists, forcing each voter to pick three of those five.

Along with Belichick, the other four finalists include Patriots owner Robert Kraft, former quarterback Ken Anderson, former running back Roger Craig and former defensive end L.C. Greenwood.

ESPN writer and Hall of Fame voter Mike Sando explained the difficult process of voting for these players, saying that they have an extremely high bar to clear.

I'm a HOF voter who saw Belichick as slam-dunk. I don't know anything about voting results, but if this is true, and we'll find out officially next week, the question is, how could this happen?

Before I list possibilities, understand this:

Belichick, Kraft, Craig, Anderson &‚Ä¶ https://t.co/V8okBDsReH

‚Äî Mike Sando (@SandoNFL) January 27, 2026

MORE:¬†Who is on the Mount Rushmore of Boston sports?

"Spygate" was a Patriots cheating scandal from the 2007 season. Then-New York Jets head coach, and former Patriots assistant, Eric Mangini tipped off the NFL to the Patriots illegally videotaping Jets' defensive signals on the sidelines.

The NFL ultimately fined Belichick $500,000, the Patriots $250,000, and forced New England to forfeit its 2008 first-round pick.

MORE: What was Bill Belichick's record without Tom Brady

When Belichick found out he did not make the Hall of Fame, the veteran coach was understandably upset. ESPN reports that Belichick was¬†"puzzled" and "disappointed" by his omission from the Hall this year, as he believes he was left out due to "politics"instead of accomplishments.

"Six Super Bowls isn't enough?" Belichick reportedly asked an associate.¬†"What does a guy have to do?"

MORE: The 10 longest-tenured coaches in NFL history

Here are the hall-of-fame coaches who were elected to the Hall on first ballot.

Both Halas and Lambeau were elected to the Hall of Fame as part of the first ever induction class, so they weren't first-ballot in the same way the other three were. Shula is the all-time wins leader, while he, Landry and Noll have a combined eight Super Bowl titles and 15 Super Bowl appearances.

MORE:¬†Breaking down the worst losses of Bill Belichick's career

There are 50 Hall of Fame voters that comprise of NFL writers and a media members. Among the voters are foremr Indianapolis Colts GM Bill Polian, who works for SiriusXM NFL radio and reportedly believes Belichick should wait a year to be inducted.

The full list of NFL Hall of Fame voters can be found here.

Bill Belichick has six Super Bowl victories, which is the most all-time among NFL coaches. Only Tom Brady has more Super Bowls as a player, and six of his seven came with Belichick as his head coach.

Bill Belichick is 73 years old, but is still coaching as he is about to enter his second season as North Carolina's head coach.

Two Chelsea fans were treated at a local hospital following an attack in Naples on Tuesday night.

NAPLES, ITALY ‚Äì FEBRUARY 20: (EDITORS NOTE: This photograph was taken using a drone) An aerial view of ‚ÄúDiego Armando Maradona‚Äù stadium on February 20, 2023 in Naples, Italy. (Photo by Claudio Villa/Getty Images)

LONDON, ENGLAND ‚Äì OCTOBER 04: Estevao Willian (l) celebrates alongside Reece James after scoring the winning goal during the Premier League match between Chelsea and Liverpool at Stamford Bridge on October 04, 2025 in London, England. (Photo by Michael Steele/Getty Images)

Speaking on RMC Sport show, Rothen S‚Äôenflamme, the former Monaco player has revealed that Lille OSC are interested in signing Mathys Tel (19) on loan from Tottenham Hotspur.

However, the Spurs head coach is reluctant to see any players leave North London before the end of the transfer window, making a potential move for the former Bayern Munich forward difficult for the Ligue 1 club.

Lille are not the only club to show an interest in the France youth international forward. Paris FC have also shown an interest in signing him on loan. Nevertheless, with Frank reluctant to see players depart before the window closes, a move looks unlikely.

title: Micah's takeaways from Sam Darnold and Seahawks' NFC title game win
description: With Sam Darnold showing he can play elite football in big moments, there is no reason left to doubt the Seattle Seahawks
fullText:
For the Seahawks to punch their ticket to the Super Bowl, it took everyone being at their best, but most importantly, they needed their quarterback, Sam Darnold, to lead the way. That is exactly what he did, as he delivered the best performance of his career. Many other Seahawks stars stepped up, but this time, Sam Darnold led the way to victory.

Here are my takeaways from the Seahawks' big win to send them to the Super Bowl:

In a game where Darnold needed to be at his best, he was. Matthew Stafford was his usual elite self, and he had no problem vs the Seahawks elite defense. Sam Darnold needed to match that and deliver his best game. Darnold did that, all while not throwing any turnover-worthy throws. This game displayed the best version of Darnold. He was confident, he made all the throws he needed to make, and he was good for all 4 quarters of this game. He was the MVP in this one, and many thought it would be another game where he was seeing ghosts; it was the complete opposite. The one roadblock for this team was going to be whether or not Darnold can be great, and now that he has, all that is left is to win a game that they will be favored by a decent margin. Such a huge moment for Sam Darnold and a great turning point for his career.

Jaxon Smith-Njigba was dominant vs the Rams, and there was not a single thing the Rams' corners could do to stop him. Jaxon Smith-Njigba had 10 catches for 153 yards and a touchdown. The field had multiple great receivers on it, but it was Jaxon Smith-Njigba who looked like the most elite one. His elite route running was on full display, and his technical precision makes him a nightmare for anyone guarding him. It felt very easy any time he and Darnold connected. That should be a duo that has a lot of success the next few years together in Seattle. Moving on from DK Metcalf had to be done, but many did not expect Jaxon Smith-Njigba to emerge as that guy so quickly. He has shown truly what a number 1 receiver really looks like. After this great performance and most likely another one in the Superbowl he should enter next season in the best receiver in the league conversations.

Klint Kubiak, this season, helped Sam Darnold pick up right where he left off in Minnesota this season. Darnold was elite once again, but this offense this season was very well-rounded. In 2024-25, the Seahawks could not run the ball. This season, both Zach Charbonnet and Kenneth Walker ran for over 700 yards. Kenneth Walker looks like a top back in the league once again. Jaxon Smith-Njigba looks like the best receiver in the NFL, and he led the NFL in receiving yards with nearly 1800 on the season. That all happens because of how good Klint Kubiak called this offense. He put everyone in the best position possible to have great years. The Seahawks offense, as a result of that, was a top ten unit all across the board. The defense gets a bit of the spotlight for this team, but it was the offense that won the game vs the Rams on Sunday.

The most successful defensive head coach in recent memory has been Bill Belichick. People tend to believe you cannot win with a coach that is a defensive mind. The league has changed to benefit the offensive side of the ball, and the most successful coaches tend to be offensive-oriented. That has changed this season as Mike Macdonald has cultivated a nightmare defense and has changed the culture completely in Seattle. The defense he has built in Seattle has carried this team a long way, and he is not getting outcoached by the best offensive minds in the league. He is winning those battles. Mike Macdonald, most importantly, has proven he can get it right with hiring the best offensive coordinator possible, and Klint Kubiak was a home run. Macdonald has taken his squad to the Super Bowl in his second season as head coach, all while being in the toughest division in the NFL, quite an impressive feat for a defensive coach.

The winner of the NFC Championship game was ultimately going to be at the very least the favorite to win it all. The Patriots, while demonstrating an elite defense, have given many reasons to be concerned that they can put up enough points to win against Seattle or the Rams. Sam Darnold got the monkey off his back and now this team has nothing left to hold them back. The Seahawks were the most complete football team this entire season, and I think they show it on February 8th by blowing out the Patriots. Sam Darnold will be the first Trojan to start in and win a Super Bowl.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Key reasons for Seattle Seahawks' NFC championship win over Rams

title: Team USA‚Äôs 2026 WBC roster could be the best baseball team ever
description: If you‚Äôve ever complained that the U.S. treats the World Baseball Classic like extended spring training, congratulations: Team USA appears to have heard you. The early commitments for 2026 look like a cheat code ‚Äì power, speed, and (finally) pitching‚Ä¶
fullText:
If you‚Äôve ever complained that the U.S. treats the World Baseball Classic like extended spring training, congratulations: Team USA appears to have heard you. The early commitments for 2026 look like a cheat code ‚Äì power, speed, and (finally) pitching that isn‚Äôt just guys who answered the phone.

Start with the face of the team: Aaron Judge isn‚Äôt just participating ‚Äì he‚Äôs Team USA‚Äôs captain. And that‚Äôs not a ceremonial title, it‚Äôs a signal that this run is serious. Mark DeRosa is back as manager, and MLB‚Äôs Michael Hill is the GM, plus the coaching staff has legit teeth ‚Äì Skip Schumaker, Andy Pettitte, Matt Holliday, David Ross, and more.

The bats are obnoxious, in the best way, of course. Judge is joined by Bryce Harper at first base, Bobby Witt Jr. and Gunnar Henderson up the middle, Alex Bregman on the dirt, plus Will Smith behind the plate, and Kyle Schwarber (DH) to launch nukes. Toss in Corbin Carroll‚Äôs rocket wheels, Byron Buxton‚Äôs ceiling, and Pete Crow-Armstrong‚Äôs glove-and-guts energy, and this lineup can win pretty, win ugly, and win loud.

Now the scary part: pitching. Team USA already has Paul Skenes and Tarik Skubal, and MLB.com points out that means the U.S. can roll out both 2025 Cy Young winners. Add Logan Webb for innings and steady, Clayton Kershaw for the big-game aura, and Mason Miller for 101-mph late-inning violence, and you‚Äôve got a staff that looks built to dominate.

And yes, the road map helps. Pool B is in Houston at Daikin Park (Brazil, Great Britain, Mexico, Italy), quarterfinals are back in Houston, and the semifinals and final are in Miami. Translation: Team USA gets a home-field runway ‚Äì if it handles business early.

Why the urgency? Because the U.S. won the Classic in 2017, it then had to settle for silver in 2023. This roster is built to win it all again, and it‚Äôs doing it the right way: depth, velocity, and star power.

Is it already the best Team USA WBC roster ever? Absolutely. And the most dangerous part is what‚Äôs still possible: final rosters aren‚Äôt even out yet ‚Äì meaning the best ever conversation isn‚Äôt just smoke.

fullText:
According to¬†Fabrizio Romano, Toulouse have rejected to offers for Charlie Cresswell (23) during the winter transfer window, including one from Brighton and Hove Albion. Les Violets want to keep the Englishman and don‚Äôt plan to sell him in January.

In addition to an offer from the Seagulls, the Ligue 1 club has also received an offer from Wolfsburg. The value of the two offers are ‚Ç¨24m from the Premier League club and ‚Ç¨25m from the Bundesliga club. Both of these bids have been rejected by Toulouse.

Interest in the former Leeds United defender is high. Despite only receiving offers from Brighton and Wolfsburg, they are not the only clubs interested in signing the 23-year-old centre back. title: Man bailed after alleged amateur football assault
description: North Wales Police is investigating an alleged attack during an amateur football match on Saturday.
fullText:
A 35-year-old man has been released on conditional bail following an alleged attack during a North Wales amateur football match.

The man was arrested on suspicion of assault following an incident during the Ardal North West League game between Trearddur Bay and Porthmadog on 17 January.

Footage of the incident at Y Traeth (The Beach) stadium in Gwynedd has circulated widely on social media.

North Wales Police said it was working closely with the victim and appealed for witnesses.

District inspector Iwan Jones said: "We are appealing for the individual who filmed the video to come forward so that an evidential statement can be obtained and formally included within the case file submitted to the Crown Prosecution Service.

"This is an active investigation and sharing certain information, or speculating about guilt or innocence, can have legal consequences, including being held in contempt of court."

Trearddur Bay has apologised for the incident and have since released player Tom Taylor following an emergency general meeting of the committee on Sunday.

The club added: "[We] will fully cooperate with any external investigations or disciplinary processes and will make no further comment at this time while these matters are ongoing."

The Football Association of Wales (FAW) is also investigating the matter and has banned the player from all football-related activity pending the outcome.

"Following a review by an independent chair, a decision has also been taken to impose an interim suspension on Thomas Taylor from all football-related activity with immediate effect under FAW Rule 39.6, pending the outcome of the FAW's investigation into the events of 17 January, 2026, and any subsequent disciplinary proceedings," they wrote.

Porthmadog FC said player Danny Brookwell was recovering at home after being concussed in the incident.
